biotools.summary:
A bioinformatics software for bidirectional identification of sRNA-target pairs with co-regulatory sRNAs information.

Some categories of small RNAs (sRNAs) in plants, such as microRNA (miRNAs), trans-acting small interfering RNAs (ta-siRNAs) and small interfering RNAs (siRNAs), often regulate the expressions of target genes through cleavage of complementary mRNAs and play an important role in the biological processes such as plant development, metabolism and diseases resistance. Identifying the target genes of these sRNAs is an important step in our understanding of their functions.

bioschemas.name: sRNATargetDigger
